channel.title: Comments on: MySQL Cluster Evaluation Guide – refreshed for Cluster 7.2 DMR
channel.description: Database technologies - especially around scalability and High Availability

item.title: By: admin
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/mysql-cluster/mysql-cluster-evaluation-guide-refreshed-for-cluster-7-2-dmr#comment-571">David</a>.
David, unfortunately I'm not allowed to comment on the timing of GA beyond something so generic that it won't help you (Oracle revenue-recognition rules). Obviously I'll announce on this blog (and via @clusterdb twitter account) as soon as it goes GA.
Andrew.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to David.

David, unfortunately I’m not allowed to comment on the timing of GA beyond something so generic that it won’t help you (Oracle revenue-recognition rules). Obviously I’ll announce on this blog (and via @clusterdb twitter account) as soon as it goes GA.

Andrew.

item.title: By: David
item.dc:creator: David
item.description: Do you have any idea when 7.2 will be GA? My company is waiting for 7.2 to be production ready before we migrate from InnoDB and replication to MySQL cluster. Thanks.
item.content:encoded: Do you have any idea when 7.2 will be GA? My company is waiting for 7.2 to be production ready before we migrate from InnoDB and replication to MySQL cluster. Thanks.
